page.title: 07The Old School
page.content: The old school is built of Northamptonshire sandstone. It is situated in the old village next to the Church and by the side of the village green. It was left to the village by Mrs. Dickson. There was only one teacher, and it consisted of one classroom and a little cloakroom. In March 1940, there were 26 children on roll. The children used to do Maypole dancing on the village green outside the School. In 1964, the new school was built. There is now a group of people in the village who hope to turn the old school into a village hall to be used for meetings, parties, and discos. In 1985, it is hoped to restore this listed building with the aid of funds and grants. Joined onto the old school is what was formerly the School House. It is still lived in, but not by teaching staff.
